intro: Borreria ocymifolia, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy species suited to arid environments. Its flowers, which are often pink or purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Borreria ocymifolia is also sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and resilience.
